website_summaries.verdict: A few design flaws, but ideal for owners of multiple cats who need to clean boxes frequently. Enclosure and air filter keep odors to a minimum, but larger cats may not fit through the door.
pros: Three level tray system is very efficient
Tray is deep, holds more litter than others in its price range
cons: Large sifter holes allow solid waste to pass through
Litter clings to the sifter and bottom of tray

customer_reviews.title: Great design
customer_reviews.text: I didn't read the description when I bought this. Just needed a litter box with a lid. So I was pleasantly surprised when I opened to see it's a sifting pan. It's a little smaller than my old one but I have a small cat so not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: emma

customer_reviews.title: Just Don't Get This
customer_reviews.text: Only closes when the 2 identical bottom pans and a screening pan are all stacked inside - which makes it quite heavy for the flimsy clips when Empty. So, the bottoms of the 2 bottom pans, and the screen have been in contact with the urine and feces. Good luck juggling all 4 pieces without setting any down that will then put that in contact with your floors. Plan on laying out a blue tarp on your garage floor to accommodate this 4 piece sifting process, or you could go to the carwash with the whole shebang.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the standard pan!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about buying this because I was not sure if my kitty would take to a new litter box, but low and behold my boy is very smart and seems to have no problem with change. I love how it looks aesthetically, the gold color is really pleasing to me. But the color is not the important part. Getting this litterbox will help save you time and the nastiness of cleaning it. You don't even have to scoop clumps anymore. Just pour the litter into the sifter, dump the clumps and restart! So simple, so much less disgusting. Get the best for your cats, guys.
customer_reviews.author: Gabbi Uzumaki

customer_reviews.title: Makes cleaning the litter box a BREEZE!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you're like me, when it comes to cleaning the kitty litter boxes, it not that it takes so long to do it but it's not a very fun task that causes my back to hurt and can be rather dusty. Sifting through the litter with the slotted scoop is a tedious task and not all that rewarding. Well .... using these boxes with the removable litter pan allows me to clean a single box in less than 30 seconds, start to finish. It's still not any more fun to do but I don't have to endure it as long! You won't be sorry if you decide to try these out.
customer_reviews.author: Jay E. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great for single cat life
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 3 star because of the material made, it is easily bendable when under certain weight. I have a cat who likes to pee .....alot, so she leaves mounds of wet liter and that offsets the balance. It does help contain the mess that cats sometimes make by kicking the liter over their "business", and as for smell it does help reduce the amount of odor that the room experiences but it does not completely hide it. It is fairly easy to clean, as long as you dont mind bending and spraying out the filter crate every few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Nothing special
customer_reviews.text: I tried setting this up "the right way" with the sifter between the two regular boxes, and pouring the litter through the sifter to clean it, then re-arranging to put the sifter back in the middle. Doesn't work well because the holes in the sifter are too big, so I need to re-sift with a hand sifter anyway. And I found that for some reason, my cat tracks poop out of this litter box although he has not done that with his other litter box. I can't explain why that might happen, but it happens. Overall I wouldn't buy this litter box again, I would just pick one up at a store. This doesn't seem to be anything special.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This litter box was better than I expected! I was looking for a covered litter box because my kitten was spreading litter EVERYWHERE and the smell was horrible with the open litter box. I wasn't sure how the "sifting" thing would work, but the main thing I've noticed is that the smell is gone and the litter is contained. I still use a scoop to clean the litter every few days and have not tried the self-sifting thing yet, but the fact that I'm not having to sweep up litter every day or smell the litter box as soon as I walk in the door has been amazing.
customer_reviews.author: A. Presley

customer_reviews.title: Saves a little time on cleanup — not as much as expected
customer_reviews.text: Shorter time to scoop litter — While the pan reduces the need to shovel litter, used litter gets stuck on the bottom grill and you will still need to shovel litter. If your cats use it on the sides, you will need to shovel that as well. 4 clasps hold the pans together and strong enough for you to lift the entire box with litter inside — however the clasps get undone quite frequently when you move the box, lift from the handle Still glad to get the unit but it has the issues listed above.
customer_reviews.author: GamerForever

customer_reviews.title: The Best Litterbox We've Used Thanks to Brilliant, Wonderful Reviewers!
customer_reviews.text: Read reviews by Anne Perry and/or bobaroo! (There are others as well.) I read their tips before purchasing this, and I followed them (they are very, very easy to follow). I'm at this moment purchasing a second of these since the first one has passed the test of being the easiest box we've ever had (including automatic litter boxes). The cats like it, of course (as if they didn't, nothing else would matter). It's a good size. It's the smallest we've had, but our 16+ pound cat jumps in and out happily. For some reason, they track less litter with this than with the dozens of other boxes we've tried. I don't have a mat or anything. Can't explain it.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Worst Ever! Mold problem
customer_reviews.text: This is a good box in theory but in practice is a nightmare. I have used World's Best litter for many years which is a clumping, corn-based litter. The litter just gathers in the grate and disgusting mold grows there and clogs it up making it completely useless and disgusting. Also it is really difficult to assemble correctly, the front/back of each layer look the same but need to go in a particular direction to close correctly, there should be a marking on one end to make it more obvious. This is going in the trash after just about 1 month as no matter how often I clean/sift there is this serious mold.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Van Ness Sifting Enclosed Cat Litter Pan
customer_reviews.text: Litter pan is on the medium side which is fine for our 2 cat home. It does come with a sifting pan, but I chose not to use it for now, our kitty is using it as a nesting spot ( see photo). Its attractive (see photo) but more importantly it suits our medium size kitty's. It comes with instructions on how to use sifter. Very good value and price, still much less expensive than many I've seen. Our kitty's have used it without flap, because its scares them (: Excellent Value!!!
customer_reviews.author: Saywhat4you

customer_reviews.title: easy to clean and maintane.  I have had it for a while and really love it and so do the cats.
customer_reviews.text: I no longer stack the two bottom pans as it is too hard for me. I jest set the empty pan aside until I am ready to use it. the cats seem to like it as it holds a fair amount of litter and does not stink. Just purchased a second box. I have one that you roll to clean. It makes a mess on the floor as litter leaks during the rolling. Update, just purchased a send one as I noticed I am getting less littler on the floor. My cats like to dig to the bottom an wet on the pan. These pans clean with very little effort. No scrubbing. Yeah
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: Decent Product - Access door poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: Update: I need to lower the rating. After having it for 34-35 days...I have to say the food is not well designed....the cat was partially trapped in there twice due to the faulty design. So, I just removed it. Not the most desirable solution, but duct tape had to replaced almost weekly in order to avoid trapping out cat. Since the cat has a kitty door into the garage, and the litter box is in the garage, we can tolerate it. But.... Great litter box. Only complaint...the door is hinged in a flimsy manner and falls off easily....Finally used a bit of duct tape to remedy.
customer_reviews.author: PMG

customer_reviews.title: Great deal, the reviews are very helpful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my kitten likes to throw his litter when he's irritated or bored, I followed the reviews that state you should put the sifter in the inactive box under the active box & my little trouble maker loves it. He hangs out playing in the litter when it's clean, plays with the door & clean up is a lot easier. I did have issues with the door getting caught & trapping the kitten, but in messing with it, I learned that if you turn the lid to the other direction, it should work fine. I feel like the price is perfect for this box & the sifter is helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Brat79

customer_reviews.title: Great idea. Works great
customer_reviews.text: Great idea. Works great. I agree with others who have reviewed it, put the sifter in the middle, dump the top pan into that, lift sifter, dump waste, put sifter on top of now empty pan & put underneath the now full pan. I have had some problems that it is too heavy for me to lift, as I have arthritic hands, so my husband has been emptying it, & also it is hard to even get hold of the top pan, but possibly that is because it is still relatively new. I'm going to try getting the lighter litter in the same brand we currently use & try to gradually switch to that. Hopefully that will work.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will likely replace other boxes with these
customer_reviews.text: Just got this last week and so far I’m definitely sold on how it works. We have 3 cats and I’m admittedly not the best at keeping their boxes clean, but this box is so easy that I think it will help me keep up with them better. Some stuff did stick to the sifting tray, but I just kinda scraped it out with my litter scoop, no biggie. Much easier than scooping everything, less bending over and coming in contact with litter and poop. I will likely buy 2 more of these to replace my 2 regular boxes, but I want to give this one a thorough test run before I commit
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This has cut my litter cleaning time in half! I took other reviews advice in that I only leave the first blue tub full of litter for the cats to use then when it’s time to clean I dump it into the second blue tub with the black sifter on top. This way the urine doesn’t cake onto the black sifter layer and makes clean up easier. Once I’m done I just set the black layer in the now emptied first blue tub and set it aside (a little litter/urine sticks to it so I don’t set the second tub back on the black and first tub so the bottom doesn’t get dirty). Super quick and easy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase if you're not using the sifting option.
customer_reviews.text: Great litter box for the price. Only downfall is the sifting. When the urine soaks to the bottom you are left scooping the layer beneath and it clumps all up and gets stuck in the sifting holes. I have tried 3 different litters thinking that might be the issue. I just do not use the sifting layer and it works great, only downside with that is the top lid can no longer latch without using all 3 layers.
customer_reviews.author: sjones6321

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst idea ever! The litter does not sift easily and has caused me so much work to clean the box. The liter get stuck in the grate and is hell to clean it. I ended up putting it in the shower to clean it then of course the litter is all over the bathtub and I will have to bleach that now also. Besides that, you can not "reuse" the clean litter because of the design. I would send this back in a heartbeat but I'm not about to wash and clean it and go through the hassle of returning a used cat box. JUST SAVE YOURSELF A HASSLE AND DO NOT BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.author: Godisgood

customer_reviews.title: EH.... had problems
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely did not like the cleaning process. My cat does not understand covering his poo!! So we needed something to help with the stink... Keeps the smell under control, but the door has came off a few times. Cleaning was worse than a normal cat box for me. It was heavy and the switch of the bases didn't work because you would end up with a dirty floor. Cat litter got stuck in the sifting area. We tried 3 different brands of litter and still wasn't work like I hoped. Very decent for the overall price though. I completely removed the sifting layer.
customer_reviews.author: Dkm90

customer_reviews.title: LOVE  LOVE  LOVE
customer_reviews.text: so far so good, in fact happy enough I ordered a 2nd one. I dont use the lid provided it is simply too small/low for my 2 girls to climb in/out comfortably and they weigh only 11 lbs. But went to WalMart and found a couple storage bins the perfect size to slip on top of the 3 pans and "lock" into place. I cut a large hole for entry/exit and we were good to go. I can sift the dirty litter and put in a fresh pan liner in 2 minutes and I am done for several days. Hardly any spillage on floor.
customer_reviews.author: Cricket

customer_reviews.title: Pretty small for a large cat and the door doesn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty small for a large cat and the door doesn't stay on, as mentioned in other posts, so litter gets kicked everywhere, but the ease of the sifting tray is great. I have another large top entry litter box that I use the sifting tray to clean. Considering the price it was worth it just for the sifting tray. Much like other reviewers stated, if you plan on trying out this litter box keep the sifter between the two solid trays to prevent wet litter from getting clumped inside the holes! Now they just need to make an extra large top entry version of this!!!!
customer_reviews.author: camille

customer_reviews.title: There is a KEY to using these type of boxes.
customer_reviews.text: KEY: There is a key to using these type of boxes so the screen does NOT get gummed up. DON'T use it as the instructions show on this litter box. You can line the pans if you like (I did). THEN you put the screen BETWEEN the two pans. When the litter needs cleaning, pick up the lined pan and dump the dirty litter into the screen and pan under the dirty pan. LAST pick up the screen and discard the contents. Put the screen UNDER this clean pan, and put the now empty pan UNDER the Screen. Your screen will stay cleaner longer.
customer_reviews.author: L C

customer_reviews.title: Good litter box but be careful.
customer_reviews.text: This litter box is a lot nicer than what I expected. The are incredibly large and nice. If you plan on buying and using this litter box you just need to be careful to place the lid on the right way. If you put the lid on backwards then the flap will flap inwards but not outwards. This caused one of my Kitty's to temporarily trapped in the litter box once. Thankfully I was right there when it happened. I am careful with how I put the lid on now and always give the flap a tap and make sure it swings both ways. Other than that they are worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Helps reduce trailed litter foul odors. Speeds up cleaning.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to control my cats from kicking the litter out of the box habits. There’s about an 80% reduction in liter on the floor for my household. Also to control the smell. I don’t smell it unless I’m pretty much on top of the box where the scent gets out between the air filter pads. The clips holding the top to the base are difficult to remove, so much so that I leave them undone. However, I like the screen sifter and multiple inter-changable trays. It really is faster than scooping. I would like if there was a skylight in the top of the lid so the cats have some light in there. Overall I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: TheCalvs

customer_reviews.title: Everything is fine except the swinging door sticks
customer_reviews.text: As mentioned by others, it seems the manufacturers of these types of covered cat litter boxes can't figure out how to make a swing door that swings both ways without getting stuck. The cats either can't get in or can't get out. They finally just broke the swinging door off. This isn't a problem with just this brand, it is true of the other one I bought as well. Same problem. Pushes in first time, then gets stuck on inside. Other than that, it is as advertised and works well, but with the open door the odor gets out.
customer_reviews.author: LR

customer_reviews.title: NOT for sifting Pine Litter pellets
customer_reviews.text: I got this hoping it would be able to sift pine wood litter pellets from the dust the litter creates. The openings of the sifter on this item are too large and pine litter pellets fall through. It has 2 pans so I still use the pans and a normal litter scooper to sift through very week or so. I removed the door flap and tabs on the hood of the box. The flap got stuck when I first got the litter box and my cat couldn’t get out of it. I also removed the clips because it was a hassle to unclip them for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Cammie

customer_reviews.title: Good buy if you're going natural
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this litter box to start my cats on natural pellets, I was tired of scooping stinky clay cat litter. This box works well however, the pellets get stuck in the grooves and there is very little space for the saw dust to fall into after the cats urinate. Overall I am satisfied takes a little more work than the normal cat litter but I rather spend more time than money one 20lb bag of natural pellets cost $5 and lasts for months. I did have to put a odor absorber next to the box to make the smell of their bowel movements when I am not able to clean it right away.
customer_reviews.author: RBrewster

customer_reviews.title: Multiple cats, multiple rooms. Easy to clean, cats adapted easily
customer_reviews.text: Two new kittens, two older cats, these were a godsend. Tested with one. Then got another, now three. So easy to use, fast so Daily is no biggie. Feel better using less litter. Seems very sturdy. Might be a bit gentle with the clasps since they are all a rather hard plastic. Can be a bit heavy pulling the 1st tray out with weight of litter etc. just be prepared you are in effect lifting most of the weight of the litter 3x or so between sifting and shifting the pcs. Sturdy and easy to clean, cats adopted quickly. Nice to have covered.
customer_reviews.author: cityToCountry

customer_reviews.title: Needed new boxes and giving these a try
customer_reviews.text: We are upgrading from our previous sifting catboxes because we needed a larger size for our boys, but also one with a cover because we have a little one on the way! I searched everywhere and this is about the only litter box I can find that fits all our needs. We just set them up so I'm not sure how they will do, but I'm sure they will work just fine. I'm worried about the handles on top but all seems to be holding together well so far. If anyone has multiple pets I definitely recommend the sifting feature with whatever box you choose because it makes cleaning so much quicker and more efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra K

customer_reviews.title: Fine design as sifting or standard box
customer_reviews.text: This is a well built and designed litter box. I have personally abandoned the sifting functionality and have been using it as a regular box. The sifting worked well enough, but it was simply messier and more work than manually cleaning. I only have one cat so those with many may find it a more useful function. That aside, this product still stands on its' own as a standard litter box. The biggest shortcoming of the design is that the lid fits in both the correct and backward position, however in the backward position the door can not swing open. My feline friend was not entertained by being locked out of his toilet. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: A. Corpolongo

customer_reviews.title: Not the worst, but difficult for me to manage
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of the box as my cats are very big (tall and long), however I would've rathered pay an extra 10 or even 20 dollars for a better quality of plastic. It is difficult for me to manage as the plastic is a bit flimsy. Overall I am satisfied but am still on the search for a better quality box. Would I buy it again? Right now I'd say yes...however if there is a box out there the same size, with a hood, that has a stronger plastic material I would trade this one for that instantly!
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size for Smaller Cat
customer_reviews.text: Received this litter box very quickly which I needed. I'm trying to finish the litter box training that apparently didn't get all done. This kitten will probably grow to a smallish cat as his mom and probable dad are small. Our other cat has an extra large box because he is big and the kitten was afraid of that box. The bottom on this one is rather deep, but the hood fits on a small shallower pan for now and I have confidence that he will convert to the cool sifter portion when he gets a little taller. I'm still keeping an eye on him, but he is doing fine with the hood minus the flap.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Big time saver for me
customer_reviews.text: Got a few of these. Doors either broken or did not work right, so just removed them from them all. Not a problem for me, but worth mentioning if the door is important to you. Other than that, one of the best litter boxes I've used to date. This GREATLY reduces my time doing the litter boxes. Don't throw away your scoop just yet though, litter still sticks to the sides, and the bottom grate. I replaced the filters that it comes with. Put in Purrifier filters on all of them, and they work well together.
customer_reviews.author: ALLEN K PRESCOTT

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY FROM THIS LITTER BOX!
customer_reviews.text: This was the absolute WORST litter box I’ve ever purchased! It seems like a great concept, but there’s no easy way to clean this box. I clean the boxes every 2-3 days and pee just gets stuck to the sifting tray and there’s no way to remove the gunk without ending up with clumps of wet clay all over the floor. I just ended up tossing the sifting part out because I couldn’t take the mess. Even lifting the sifting tray to dump the solids out was a hassle and sent litter EVERYWHERE. I regret buying this piece of crap!
customer_reviews.author: Bernice

customer_reviews.title: One week in use and handle already broken.
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept ... having a filtering level and two basins with locking top. However, the handle on one is already broken after lifting it for the first litter change. I bought two and the other has yet to break. I've used covered litter pans for over three years. The ones these are replacing finally broke around the lock which is understandable since they are opened and closed a couple of times a week for that amount of time. However, the handles have never broken. Very disappointed in the durability of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Roberson

customer_reviews.title: Over all a great product
customer_reviews.text: Item comes as described and was easy to assemble. The sifting insert that goes into the bottom of your litter box. Makes it really easy to just pick up and sift. Down fall if your pet has softer stool. They can clump up onto the sifter. So be sure to just have a shovel handy to use in case this happens. I have also noticed if your pet uses just on corner of the litter box there will be a huge clump which can adhere to the sifter. Over all it is a great product this is my second one. I will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: JustJoeyW

customer_reviews.title: Beware, Doors will not stay on.
customer_reviews.text: These boxes are superb for the money. It’s nice to find just a box with depth, surface space, with x2 pans and a cleaning grate. I just wish the doors would stay on... Probably doesn’t matter but it’s like an OCD thing. My messes and smells were knocked out almost completely upon these boxes. If you have a grown cat that walks like a princess your doors may stay on, but I have kittens and they sometimes try to get out and bat at the door. Other than that I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jwebb

customer_reviews.title: Best box I’ve ever used. Easy to clean & great value at only $15!
customer_reviews.text: It was hard keeping the smell out even when cleaning my old box EVERYDAY more than once. This one looks good, traps odor, & is super simple to clean. Also, the size of it is GREAT! I could never use one with a cover before because my big cat wasn’t able to comfortably fit & do her business. I haven’t had that problem at all since we’ve had this one & it’s been about a week now. VERY PLEASED, would definitely recommend. Also, it was ONLY $15 where as the other similar ones were up to even $40! Again, very happy
customer_reviews.author: S.Paige

customer_reviews.title: Goodish
customer_reviews.text: I do like these. Ive had 3 of these and 2 of the larger. They work ok for the most part. But after a year or so the plastic seems to get brittle and start to slowly break apart. I do keep getting them though. I have started to mix and match parts from time to time. Ive tried a few others but most of them are short and litter gets everywhere. I like the depth of these. Even though they get brittle after time, I will still probly get them. Just wish they lasted a bit longer.
customer_reviews.author: Bug

customer_reviews.title: Sifter feature is a waste.
customer_reviews.text: Well I thought I ordered the one without the sifter, but when I got this one I was thinking that this would be fine. I do not like the sifter feature and it went in the garbage. It was more hassle then just cleaning the box normally. The litter was just clumping to sifter and was more of a pain so I threw it out. I also ended up taking the door off. My cats did not like it at all, and it was a bit flimsy. I do like the rest of the box. It is large and enclosed
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but side clasps are difficult to close
customer_reviews.text: These are very sturdy and I like the sifting because I can sift out easily using with one of the trays that are within the system and simply sifted into a new container that’s in the system re-shifted positions and you got clean cat litter. The classes are difficult to close and odor is still a problem and I only have one cat. I have purchased two of these and found that when I take one out and move one in and of course clean the one I took out immediately it has helped immensely with every day things that we have to do
customer_reviews.author: Aclance

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a sifting litter box that my cat wouldn't kick the litter out. This one does that and you don't even need to use the cover because the boxes are very deep. BUT, the boxes stick together and are very hard to separate. I also practically gave myself a hernia lifting the box to sift. I'm not so young anymore and this was too much work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves to poop in this!
customer_reviews.text: When its time to poop, we all want the privacy and comfort we deserve. My cat *cracker* Loves to crap in this box! , the door, the roof, the 1970's cream gold color. Her anus respects it ;-). She can turd in style all week long, or all year long with this lavish, stylish and superb crap box! Lets look at its features! Door? Check Roof and walls!? CHECK! TWO BOTTOMS!? HELL YEAH CHECK! Sifting pan so you don't need a scoop or to get dung all over your paws!? CHECKAROONEY! Don't let your pet crap in a sub standard box! Get this one!.
customer_reviews.author: Jay7500

customer_reviews.title: Cheap in every way
customer_reviews.text: So, I was using sifting bags and decided to try this instead. Gave away my other litter box which was the same brand. Wish I kept it. This one is much cheaper plastic, does not keep clasped shut if you try to lift it by the handle, and is a pain to clean. You pretty much have to take it outside and hose it every single time, then blow-dry it fully or it will clump the litter right away. Most of the wetter litter gets stuck between the sifting screen and you'll be scraping at it for hours if you don't want to hose it.
customer_reviews.author: Vincerific

customer_reviews.title: Strangest litter box
customer_reviews.text: This is a very strange, cumbersome sifting method litter box. I bought it because it has a tall tray, even the entry is tall enough for my cat who stands and sprays so that it isn't going out of the box. But be aware that if you want to remove the sifting tray and just use it as a normal box then the lid will not lock down well. Very strange method of sifting a box clean, definitely way more trouble than just using a regular old fashioned pooer scooper!
customer_reviews.author: S. Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Handy once you get used to this cleaning method.
customer_reviews.text: Lifelong cat owner who has used many kinds of boxes. I like this one for the RV and the boat. Still trying to figure out best litter to use because the sifter has pretty big holes. I agree with the reviewers who suggested an alternate way to clean the Box. I'm still not sure it's that much better than the old method of using a scoop. I sometimes use the scoop instead. Regarding the cat door, I also agree with the criticisms there but I think a little trimming of it would keep it useful.
customer_reviews.author: Marja

customer_reviews.title: Holes Too Big for Pine Litter
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use with a pine litter as we wanted to make the switch and still have a covered box. The holes in the sifter are too big and the pine litter falls right thru when sifting. I will have to make some adjustments to the sifter to make it work. Other than that, the product is a great size and well constructed, we have another litter box we picked up at petsmart that seems to have been made with the same mold, just not with the extended clips for the stacked boxes. Perhaps I can perforate the bottom of that to make it work :)
customer_reviews.author: S. Palumbo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect litter box
customer_reviews.text: If you don’t like scooping kitty litter, this is the litter box for you! Has two bases and an insert that sifts so the poop stays in the sifter and you’re left with the good litter. Then just dump it in a bag and throw it out. Our dog was getting into the litter pan so I needed to try something with a lid. This has a door as well, but I had to take that off because she wouldn’t go in. Was easy to take the door off and on and the pans are solid. The price was great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 1/4" Hardware Cloth makes this perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Ok there is no perfect litter box for pine pellets, but this simple modification can make you think this one is it! 1/4 hardware cloth/mesh cut exactly to size and tied down on all 4 corners and the middle make this sifter perfect. No pellets go through, only the urinated sand sifts through perfectly. A few panning shakes makes the poop rise to the top and they can be easily removed. This has totally allowed to conserve on pellet waste, and definitely helps with the oder bigtime now that 100% of the urine sand is removed. Very very pleased with this box because now its incredibly clean and neat now and absolutely no pellet waste. 😁
customer_reviews.author: Ru S

customer_reviews.title: A great, cheap, sifting litter box.
customer_reviews.text: The sifting of the box was the most important part, for me, and this box does that very well. The litter box is so much easier to clean. The clear door was not working for me though. It doesn't sit well in it's grooves causing it to get stuck closed. I've just removed the door and use it without it. The clasps on the side are also hard to open. I almost think I'll cut myself trying to open them so I never lock them in place. The lid is fairly heavy so my cat isn't going to knock it off.
customer_reviews.author: Eric T

customer_reviews.title: Best litter box I have had.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome litter box. We keep our box on our back porch and this box is the best we have had. Keeps the smells down and is very easy to clean. Depending on the litter that you use some urine clumps May get stuck in the sifting grate. Very easy to knock them loose tho. Make sure you don’t put the top on backward or your cat will either get stuck out or in the box.
customer_reviews.author: B. Bass

customer_reviews.title: Love this litter box
customer_reviews.text: My sister had one for her cat, so when I got two new kittens, I knew what I had to buy. The kittens were going to be big cats so I ordered the large pan. It works great and makes changing the litter box so much easier. Some cats may not like the feel of the sifting pan when they dig in the litter, so you can put solid bottom pan, sifting pan, solid pan, then the litter. When you go to clean the box, pick up the top pan, pour it into the sifter pan and sift it into the bottom pan. Love this litter box!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper1937

customer_reviews.title: Good as a regular litter box too
customer_reviews.text: I don't even use the sifting part, it's just a good priced large litter box. But if you do use the sifting, please do NOT follow the directions, and instead listen to the alternate method that's all over the internet / Amazon reviews. So many people are probably kicking themselves. People who said sifting litter boxes were gross/difficult. The company should really change their directions on how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Expert

customer_reviews.title: Awesome litter box and well made .
customer_reviews.text: If you have a Big cat you will want the next size up this one is perfect for kitten's and small kitten size cats .. I will start out buy saying I didn't buy this for cats I bought it for a nest box for some jungle fowl size hens I and have since bought 3 more as there sturdy well made boxes For diff small chicken coops I have around the place they work great for bantam and game hen and jungle fowl size hens to lay eggs in ..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as practical
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of this litterbox. As a pet sitter have used smaller versions, but my cat is picky and likes her cover. She uses it, but don’t think she likes it much. She’s a cat... so who knows. It’s very heavy when you clean and not easy to dump the turds unless you have a garbage bag handy and someone to hold the bag. It gets messy. The idea is great, but I’m hoping my cat will eventually just want to use the smaller one that isn’t covered.
customer_reviews.author: MooMoo

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected......
customer_reviews.text: Down sides: 1) On 1st use lifting sifter cracked sifter edges. Solution? Light weight litter. As for me? My old scoop routibe works better in a lot less time. 2) High sides are good but "floor" has too many angles 3) Would have preferred if it was a few inches deeper front to back. 4) Would have returned but regular non- sifting is same price. Up sides: 1) High sides 2) Two units fit well side by side under my 3' wide shelving unit 3) price is ok all things considered.
customer_reviews.author: kw

customer_reviews.title: No handle or indentations for lifting the sifter out with soiled litter.
customer_reviews.text: It does what it is supposed to do. The biggest flaw is that the plastic is not very sturdy and has no handles or indentations for lifting the sifter up out of the pans. I can already see a few white stressed plastic spots where it is getting ready to break. The lid doesn't latch well onto the pans either, though I have no need to move the thing around so this isn't a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Setesh

customer_reviews.title: Great Litterbox!
customer_reviews.text: I love this litterbox! I was just looking for any enclosed box as my cat is rather messy. This box fit the bill. I tried to make use of the sifting mechanism, but found it to be easier to leave the sifting pan on bottom and clean with a regular scoop. This may just be due to my cat's bathroom habits though. I took off the door because my cat is pretty old and I didn't want him to be thrown off by it. I never noticed any odor with the door off using unscented litter. I shouldn't have to buy another one, but I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: No more scooping!
customer_reviews.text: I don't want cats husband does, but he doesn't like to or want to clean the box. I'm not cleaning it lol Bought this for him, he cleans it a bit more often now, it's simple to use, just shimmy the grate thing out, & dump. Put the grate in the empty base, dump the litter from one base to the other, put the empty on the bottom, & put the top back on. We had 1 cat he refused to in with the flap in place, so we had to remove it.
customer_reviews.author: jmd1993

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I have had a cat for 5 years, and adopted a puppy 10 months ago. The Humane Society DRASTICALLY underestimated what size she'd be, which causes problems for the cat, as the puppy is obsessed with her. I blocked off an area that the puppy's too big to get into, and this is in there. She loves it! I think she goes in there sometimes, just to make the puppy go crazy!! It's worked out really well, for her. Definitely recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Contessa H

customer_reviews.title: This is great catbox for larger cats
customer_reviews.text: I have one really big beef about this product and that is the sticker and tape used on the clear plastic flap. There are many glue products that are easily removed. This one was horrible! It took a teaspoon of Mayo and about 45 minutes of work to clean it up. I am not sure the door will stay anyway since the cats are easily able to pull it off. I have not cleaned it yet so not sure how easy that will be lift and clean. I will update my assessment once I have cleaned them a time or two.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding value for an enclosed litter box!
customer_reviews.text: Our petite adult Siamese kitty does terrific in going in & out of this litter box. The high sides & enclosed box keeps most of the litter inside to contain mess. I stopped using the sifter that was included and scooped instead. The sifter made cleaning more difficult as litter eventually caked in between sifter grate. For the price of this box, I don't mind. I also took the swinging door off as it wasn't staying in place. I gave this litter box 4 stars instead of 5 due to the above listed inconveniences.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hartman

customer_reviews.title: Best So Far...
customer_reviews.text: Takes a lot of the Work out of changing Cat Litter, have 2. Just Lift the Sifter -from Box1 - Sift clean Non-clumped litter through to box1 - Dump the Clumps/Trash - Reinsert Sifter into empty bottom box3, and Pour Litter over Sifter - restack the 2 boxes, one with sifter/Litter over the empty one. No Scooping, Scrapping, use Fast Clumping, and Deeper Litter...SO FAST, NEAT, and EASY!!! thank you, Van Ness CP66 Enclosed Sifting Cat Pan/Litter... Was Going to the New Flushable, Corn Based, however read the Vet Report 'Do Not Flush!!!'
customer_reviews.author: LARS

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality and big!
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is perfect for my daughters new cat. It’s actually way bigger than I thought it would be but nice! This is in my daughters large walk in closet and I buy more expensive liter because I can’t handle cat smell... so far I have yet to smell anything and I think it has a lot to do with the door! I only have to clean it out once a week... however as she grows bigger I’m sure that will change but as for now we’re happy :)
customer_reviews.author: Ryblynnh

customer_reviews.title: Ideal litter box but needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this brand litter box before and had it for several years before the plastic began to crack. The ease of cleaning the box is much better than using a traditional box with a scooper. However this new box seems to be poorly made compared to the last one that was store bought. The locking tabs that attach the hood to the pan are essentially useless. If you put your trust in them, one day you’ll end up with a box full of litter spilled when the tabs fail. If they can engineer some locking tabs that would work and maybe a thick mil plastic for the pan you’d have a AAA litter box here
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Great box but I don't use the sifter
customer_reviews.text: I thought a self sifting litter box would make my life easier, but not so. I kept the sifter between the two pans like other reviews suggested. It worked...but little bits of wet litter still stuck to the sifter and it's a pain to clean. Only used the sifter a few times, now I scoop with a shovel. It is a very sturdy box, all the components fit together perfectly. Overall I think it's a good self shifting litter box, but they just aren't for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Nixon

customer_reviews.title: easier than scooping
customer_reviews.text: kind of heavy for me as a 62 yr old woman but I manage...a little messy because some litter always ends up on the floor but still better than scooping...very large which I like but it does make them heavier...and yes as other reviewers have noted put the screen part in the center of the 3 pieces for best results. I purchased 2 for my 3 cats and took the doors off. I left one door on to see if they would use it but the only used the one with no door. glad I purchased them
customer_reviews.author: barbara lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Depends on the cat
customer_reviews.text: We took in a feral cat who had become pretty domesticated but like to do his business on the carpet (yuk!). He was pretty scared of this at first, but we tried removing the top part and after two weeks, he’s using it. We hope one day to try adding the top back on but, in the meantime I don’t have to clean up cat poo, so this is worth it! It’s also quite well made and easy to clean out. I’m very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Londonnoise

customer_reviews.title: Great...so far!
customer_reviews.text: It arrived (via USPS) as promised. Product was undamaged and easy to assemble. It does appear that it could be a bit more durable, but my 20 lb kitty loves that he has a box in which he can comfortably turn around! The door ensures that I smell no kitty poo when he goes😊. I haven’t cleaned it yet because we just got it, that’s the only reason for 3 stars there. So far, I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Anthonette

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother, just keep buying expensive sifting pan liners.
customer_reviews.text: Was tired of paying for sifting cat pan liners so gave this a try. Waste of time and money- tried both ways- the way described in the reviews as well as the way noted with the product- but a successful system- really gross as it didn’t sift the waste from the litter but the waste got smeared all over the sister when trying to sift. Really gross. Nice large box for a cheap price, but was hoping the softer tray would replace the need for disposable sifting liners. Gave a way to someone who needed a large cat box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: The sifting pan is my new best friend! No more scooping, scraping, or sifting through litter. With this litter box cleaning is done in a matter of seconds. It has a top with an odor filter and carrying handle, a sifting pan, and two litter pans - a big plus! The door is removable, which is nice for cats (like mine) who aren't comfortable with doors. Lastly, everything snaps into place, including the second litter pan. I highly recommend this product. Please note: this litter box (size large) is unlikely to work for more than one cat, but they do offer the same model in a larger size.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: I think it's a good box
customer_reviews.text: This is wider than I had expected. Which is totally fine. I had to take the door off for my cat. Apparently he thought I was locking him up and would cry. So we took it off this is actually a second box. We kept closing him in the basement. Well now he has a spot that isn't the sink if he gets closed in. Wide enough I think he is comfortable. And easy enough to sift through and change the litter. Seemed sturdy enough while also being light weight. I approve. I like that it clips down on the sides.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Best litter pan ever
customer_reviews.text: Loved the box! It works perfect. I used it as described by other users. Placed the litter on the top pan, the swifter in the middle, other pan underneath. When ready to change just pour litter through swifter to bottom pan and place the top (now empty) litter pan at the bottom; the swifter contains all the clumps and you can easy throw away. Put back together and voila! Clean box! Also removed the door :)
customer_reviews.author: Luciana

customer_reviews.title: Make sure your cat has long legs.
customer_reviews.text: Opening is so high that unless your cat has long legs, they will have trouble getting in/out. Great concept, but hard to pick up the heavy sifter. End up needing to clean the box before stacking so it is not dirty. Worked so much better in the space than what I had, but will have to go back to the other choice because of the height issue. If you have a tall cat - it would be great.
customer_reviews.author: allegro

customer_reviews.title: Sifter doesn't work. Nice litter boxes.
customer_reviews.text: Thought this was a good idea. Unfortunately, it did not work for my cat. The holes in the sifter are too big. The litter goes through as well as some of the poop and pee. The worst part is that a lot of the poop and pee gets stuck inside the sifter's holes (see pics). Can't even scrape it all off. Also, if the poop is soft when pouring the litter, it will stick on the side of the sifter. Threw away the sifter (was a mess) and will use the litter boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Tomi

customer_reviews.title: Needs to Be More Durable
customer_reviews.text: 🙄 I love this thing, using it the alternative way others described in reviews (DO NOT LEAVE THE SIFTER IN THE CAT BOX) but one of the clips that locks the top to the bottom has already given out, after less than 2 months of use.. which is fine, unless you aren't expecting it or forget and go to pick it up over the doggie gate and BAM there goes the bottom half and dirty litter all over the floor 😅 at least my dog was excited.
customer_reviews.author: Momma And Wife

customer_reviews.title: Did not work with feline pine pellets
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my feline pine cat litter but the slits are too large and the pine pellets fall right through then the wet grain stuck to the bottom and between the holes. I'm sure this would work fine for clumping clay litter but for pellets it did not work for me. As for the size, my cat is 9lbs and very long and lean but seemed cramped so I would suggest just buying the extra large unless you have a small cat.
customer_reviews.author: Katana

customer_reviews.title: Very Good!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and keep clean! TRICK: PUT THE SIFTER PAN in between the other two trays to keep it clean. If you put it on TOP as the first tray (as recommended by the manufacturer) then, you'll have a nightmare to clean because the wet litter and everything else will get stuck and solidify between cleanings. So, just use the other ones for every day use and keep the sifting one as a strainer when transferring the litter for one pan to the other!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Rguez

customer_reviews.title: Hard to clean and smells bad!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Male kitten that I recently adopted. He urinates outwards and I purchased this litter box expecting it to keep the urine in the box as well as the smell. It did the total opposite. Even with the top secured on top, the urine would seep out the top and get on the floor. Also the smell was gross. It was a waste of money. Cleaning the sifter inside of the box didnt work.. the urine was clump up and it was hard to clean. Do not buy this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Annmarie Rosado

customer_reviews.title: Pee or condensation?
customer_reviews.text: I have two kitties and this works well if you have a hard wood floor and place to hide it. I'm not sure if it was pee or condensation or what, but there was constantly liquid in the crack between the lid and bottom. It is gross to clean and the pan always has icky litter clumps stuck in it. I switch to a litter box with no lid and I just scoop it daily now. Much easier! I recommend not using the lid for this box and having something to catch litter under it instead.
customer_reviews.author: Kali

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: The sides of the litter boxes and sifting pan are really really frail and flimsy. If you have a decent amount of litter in the pan you will have a difficult time picking up the box to pour the litter into the sifter. The sides will want to collapse, well they do collapse. I bought some teflon spray and coated all the parts, so I can't say if it is easy to clean without it.
customer_reviews.author: squisheez

customer_reviews.title: Good litter box, but could use a little improvement
customer_reviews.text: I love the size and ease of this litter box. My one complaint is that the sifting holes are a little large, and some pieces of poop will sift through into the fresh litter. I would suggest putting the sifting tray between the two pans, because the wet litter will stick to sifter slots and are hard to clean. I keep one of the solid pieces, filled with litter, on top and just pour it into the sifter.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Channell

customer_reviews.title: Huge sifter type cat boxes
customer_reviews.text: They're huge. My cats outgrew the old pans which were noticeably smaller than this set. One of the other reviewers suggested a different way of using these pans, instead of the "litter, sifter, dirty pan, clean pan" where the sifter gets fouled from constant contact with the dirty litter, try stacking as follows: "litter, dirty pan, sifter, clean pan", when sifting the litter pour the dirty litter into the sifter, sift into the clean pan and then dispose of the droppings and clumps. That way you can easily clean the used pan and the sifter for the next use. And if your cat(s) are a bit overweight they'll appreciate the extra room!!
customer_reviews.author: Nilmar

customer_reviews.title: It works! No more slaving over a stinky litter box with a scoop...
customer_reviews.text: Makes sifting litter for two cats MUCH quicker. Some small bits still get through, but about the same as using a hand scoop, and a whole lot quicker. Suggest following the method others have mentioned, and only using the black insert when actually sifting the litter. Use the empty pan to keep loose litter from spilling everywhere when pouring into the trash. Not perfect, hence the 4 stars, but great compared to using a scoop, and much cheaper than an automatic litter box...
customer_reviews.author: S. McCarty

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy box, big fan!
customer_reviews.text: Second one I have ordered. Ordered this one to replace an identical one I bought a year and a half ago. I have two Maine Coons, one on the larger size and this box is the only one I have found so far that works for them. I stoped using the "filter ling after about six months but the box is still by far the best. Im only replacing it because it is starting to take on an unpleasant odor.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia L.

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a hooded litter box to keep the smell contained. The sifter was an added feature I didn't know I needed until I got it. I do recommend you to place the sifter all the way inside of an empty trash bag before you empty it. My cat went right to this as soon as I set it up. The door keeps my dogs from trying to eat the "cat treats" inside the box. They haven't figured out how to open it yet! Bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Lee

customer_reviews.title: Works great but plastic is a bit thin
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome for my two cats like other said it's best to put the sifting tray in between the two solid ones and not let the cats pee in the sifting tray because it will take up in the mesh. One problem I have that's not really a big deal is that the plastic is a bit thin so if you have a full pan you're dealing with you have to be careful not to let it Flex or it will crack
customer_reviews.author: jacob horth

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure this saves any cleaning time. You have to dump the litter from one to the next and my litter will clump to the grate from time to time (when soiled) the door doesn’t stay shut completely it sort of gaps open. I wanted an enclosed box to reduce odor which the door not closing seems to kind of create that issue still. If you have a large car I don’t recommend. I wouldn’t buy again, but it works for now.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well - not sure how durable and long lasting it will be
customer_reviews.text: First, this arrived with only three of the four locking tabs. I contacted the seller but never heard back from them. This box works well. The sifter makes cleaning the disgusting cat box a little easier when using clumping litter. The plastic is very lightweight - almost too light weight. When washing the box it feels as though it could easily crack - I guess I shouldn't wash it :)
customer_reviews.author: Pastcha

customer_reviews.title: Lid doesn't fit right - no way to contact Seller
customer_reviews.text: My lid doesn't fit right - when all clips are snapped down, the door hits the lip of the entry so my cat can't get OUT. In order to fix that I have to remove the door, which makes the damn think stink to high heaven. Plus, it is so HIGH my old fat cat has trouble getting out, so if I don't clip it down, the whole stupid lid falls off and the cat can't get back in.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Very large litter box which is great me for my cat but not so great when it comes time to clean it. Because it is so large when you sift out the dirty litter and empty it in a trash can or bag litter gets EVERYWHERE. I also had trouble with the wet litter clumping together on both sides of the siftef part. So it was very hard to clean and again litter everywhere. I really hate to have this problem because besides that it's a very good quality box .
customer_reviews.author: A.Sims

customer_reviews.title: Door doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: My cat was able to get in it because the flap opened to the inside. However, he licked himself inside. The box we received didn’t have a swinging door. It just swung in and not out. Cue the cat freaking out once he realized he was trapped in the box with his “business”. I took the door off (which is easy) and it seemed to not be an issue anymore. Recommend adding A LOT of litter to the box to prevent it from sticking to the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: A lot easier than digging for 'treasure'...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this litter box for an adult cat. At first he wouldn't use it with the lid, but we removed the door/flap and he apparently found that acceptable. It does get a little awkward to maneuver when using the sifter, I would suggest having a trashbag ready to dump it and a vacuum or dustpan and brush. Because of this we scoop for a couple days and then sift. I also use the liners with the elastic. If you're like me, and odor control is the main goal, this will do it (it also minimizes the the amount of wasted litter).
customer_reviews.author: MissMainey

customer_reviews.title: DONT. JUST DONT!!!!!!  !!️!!️🚫❌🛑🙅🏻‍♀️
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the messiest piece of crap ever invented. The pee clumps got stuck all up in the sifter. Took it outside to wash with a pressure hose...that was a no go. Not to mention how much of a pain it was to go through the steps to sift it. For someone with arthritis and back problems this was a NIGHTMARE. Pee clumps and litter everywhere. I finally just dumped it in the dumpster. Bye Felicia!!! Gave it one star bc zero isn’t an option 😒
customer_reviews.author: Z Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: After a modification, perfect for pine pallets.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great litter box, solved the bad smell problem with very low cost. I use pine pallets, 40lbs for several dollars. The sifting basket does have too big holes. I bought a metal rain gutter guard from Homedepot for less than $4, cut it to fit the sifter shape. Now it is perfect to sift the pine pallets. I put the sifter in the middle layer, so the urion can be absorbed by pine pallets completely. No more wet stuff and no more smells in the room.
customer_reviews.author: Tiger

customer_reviews.title: Keeps our kitten from kicking up litter all over our room.
customer_reviews.text: The litter box was perfect for our new kitten because he was kicking litter all over the place. He didn't like the door so I removed it. It sifts easily, but it doesn't get the small clumps and the litter sticks like cement to the bottom of the box. Just takes a little extra cleaning. Over all it is a lot better than a room full of litter to clean up all day.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Hughes

customer_reviews.title: The sift mechanism is more work than it is worth
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats and decided to try out this catbox, the built-in sift tray sounded like a neat idea. Unfortunately, I had to kick that piece to the curb, as it was a pain to use. You have to sift it with the large tray and somehow manage to get the feces in a bag, which proved to be a daunting task that felt more like a 2 person job. I got rid of that piece altogether and merely us it as a regular cat box. If you are looking at this for the sift tray aspect, I'd steer clear.
customer_reviews.author: Hummel

customer_reviews.title: Game changer..Its perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: Who like cleaning a litter box. And I can't spend the money on a Electric box bc the reviews are horrible and i dont think my cats would like it. I bought this quick with out reading reviews just bc i saw it had good reviews and thought how much difference ca a basic cat litter box have from any another.. i was so excited when i got it and saw that it was so much more. The fact that it has a filter makes cleaning it so easy. I am also using less litter now that im not scooping saving me money.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: It's a Yes
customer_reviews.text: You never know if you change a litter box if your 4 legged kids will like it. I have 2 cats and two litter boxes but they both seem to want to use this one. I find the system to work really well to sift the soiled litter but sometimes I also just do the normal thing and use the litter shovel to sift out the soiled litter - but whatever it works and is a nice size.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy L. Burkett

product_meta.title: Van Ness Sifting Enclosed Cat Litter Pan
product_meta.description: Size:LargeThrow out your scoop and save time with our Van Ness sifting enclosed cat pan. This smartly designed unit features two nesting pans and a sifting screen. Stack the pans with the sifting screen on top and fill with clumping litter. When you lift the sifting screen the litter sifts out into the pan, leaving the clumps that you throw away. Replace the sifting screen in the empty pan, move the litter from the full to the empty pan, restack, and your are finished. Roomy pan features a locking lid with filter, carrying handle and removable odor controlling door. Made of durable, easy to clean plastic.
feature_bullets: Ideal for owners who want the benefits of litter scoop free maintenance combined with the odor control qualities of an enclosed pan
Provides class leading odor control by enclosing litter and providing the added benefits of an odor door and replaceable zeolite air filter
High polished finish that is odor and stain resistant
Easy to clean and Assorted Colors

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
